bibl.title: Ray Raymond v. Territory of Washington. Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Spokane}ss

I do hereby return to the Honorable Judge George Turner Judge of the Fourth Judicial District Holding Terms at Spokane Falls Washington Territory that before the coming to one of the within writ the said Joseph Bradshaw was committed to my custody and is declared by writ of a commitment. A copy of which I failed to bring with me. Nevertheless, I have the body of the said Joseph Bradshaw before you as the time and place within motion. As I am within commanded
D.J. Packwood Sheriff of Kittias W.T.
by J.W. Share deputy Sheriffs Expenses

Conveying prisoner from Ellensburg W.T. To Spokane Falls, W.T. and Return to Ellensburg W.T. To Sheriffs Passage 15 days 3 at nine per day 45.00 Convey Ellensburg to Spokane Falls 271 mi at mile 10 27.10 Spokane Falls to Ellensburg W.T. 271 mi .10 27.10 4 days Board for prisoner $1.00 per day 4.00 "mileage on Prisoner 542miles 10 per mile 54.20 $157.40
Territory of Washington, County of Spokane}ss

F.W. Shaser being duly sworn, deposes and says that he is Deputy Sheriff Kittitas County W.T., that the above and foregoing account is hereby correct, and the services therein charged were actually and necessarily performed.
F.W. Shaser
Subscribed and sworn to before me this first day of June 1887
Chad B. Johnston
Dep. Court 4th Judicial Court W.T.
CASE NO. 1886
In the District Court 4th Judicial District, holding terms at Cheney, Spokane Falls. Territory of Washington
Plaintiff
vs.
Ray Raymond, defendant
Writ of Habeas Corpus Filed in the office of the Clerk of the District Court this day of 188
Clerk
Deputy
Attorney for
